summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 20, 2019. It commands the MCC to produce extensive records and have a custodian testify before the grand jury on September 10, 2019, regarding an investigation into violations of federal law, specifically concerning inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The accompanying letter requests confidentiality and preservation of records.

keyFacts: The subpoena was issued on August 20, 2019, by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman, demanding the MCC produce documents from January 1, 2019, onward for a grand jury investigation.
It specifically commands the production of all documents related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054), including Form 292, emails, internal correspondence, and notes.
The MCC must designate a custodian of records to appear before the grand jury on September 10, 2019, to testify and produce the requested materials.
The subpoena demands a wide array of MCC records, including count slips, TRUSCOPE entries, logs (visitor, attorney, lieutenant, control center), SHU records, staff assignments, and training records.

An accompanying letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office requests the MCC voluntarily refrain from disclosing the subpoena's existence to any third party to preserve the investigation's confidentiality and to preserve all records for 180 days.
